What is the purpose of the `listunspent` command?

The `listunspent` command returns an array of unspent transaction outputs with between `minconf` and `maxconf` (inclusive) confirmations. Optionally, it can filter to only include txouts paid to specified addresses.

y of transactions.   "blockindex": n,     (numeric) The block index containing the transaction. Available for 'send' and 'receive'                      category of transactions.   "txid": "transactionid", (string) The transaction id. Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.   "time": xxx,       (numeric) The transaction time in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT).   "timereceived": xxx,   (numeric) The time received in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT). Available                      for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.   "comment": "...",    (string) If a comment is associated with the transaction.   "otheraccount": "accountname", (string) For the 'move' category of transactions, the account the funds came                      from (for receiving funds, positive amounts), or went to (for sending funds,                      negative amounts).   "size": n,        (numeric) Transaction size in bytes  } ] ```Examples:List the most recent 10 transactions in the systems ```bash > verus listtransactions ``` List transactions 100 to 120 ```bash > verus listtransactions "*" 20 100 ``` As a json rpc call ```bash > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listtransactions", "params": ["*", 20, 100] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/ ```### `listunspent ( minconf maxconf ["address",...] inludeshared )` Returns array of unspent transaction outputs with between minconf and maxconf (inclusive) confirmations. Optionally filter to only include txouts paid to specified addresses. Results are an array of Objects, each of which has: {txid, vout, scriptPubKey, amount, confirmations}
